body.name: Citizen CZ Smart PQ2 Hybrid Smartwatch with YouQ Wellness app Featuring IBM Watson® AI and NASA Research, Black and White Customizable Display, Bluetooth, HR, Activity Tracker, 18-Day Battery Life
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 26 mins
features: The Smarter Hybrid: Boasting an impressive *18-day battery life and a bluetooth connection (within 30 feet), the next generation CZ Smart Hybrid smartwatch keeps you running longer and with a *faster charging time. **Citizen Connected works with phones running on the latest version of Android and iOS. *Rechargeable Battery varies based on usage; Charge time 50-minutes to 80%

Smarter smartwatch: CZ Smart YouQ a proprietary wellness app built using research by NASA Ames Center and AI Models with IBM Watson Studio. YouQ helps wearers maximize their daily potential by learning the wearer’s unique Chronotype and daily rhythms. YouQ computes HR, SP02, fitness activity, sleep, alert scores to offer the consumer 24-hour forecast of alertness. Aggregating data will enable CZ Smart YouQ to cater to wearers personally allowing them to understand their body's rhythms.

Self-care advisor YouQ uses a gamified Alert Monitor based on NASA’s PVT+. CZ Smart YouQ uses Alert Monitor scores and sleep data to identify your Chronotype a morning go-getter, steady achiever? YouQ helps you stay on track with an Hourly Power Score an indicator of your cognitive and physical energy. Power Fixes mitigate fatigue and improve alertness to optimize the day napuccino or liquid energy in your future

Personalization, notifications, and more: Stay in-the-know all day with notifications on your watch for incoming calls, texts, emails, and calendar notifications. Additional functionality from the Citizen Connected App delivers the latest Golf Report and Live Sports. You can even sync to your Nest, Hue, or Yale Lock smart systems.With Amazon Alexa built-in, you can play music, control your smart home, get information, news, weather, and more using the mic in your CZ Smart Hybrid smartwatch.

Citizen Connected works on phones running the latest version of Android (excluding Go edition and phones without Google Play Store) or iOS. Supported features may vary between platforms and countries with compatibility subject to change. Download the Citizen Connected App from the Apple App Store or Google Play store.
body.description: Introducing the second-generation CZ Smart Hybrid, the smarter smartwatch with *18-day battery life. The Citizen CZ Smart Hybrid smartwatch with 44mm stainless steel case with black topring and black silicone strap marries the iconic design you expect from Citizen with innovative science and technology in the proprietary new app, YouQ. CZ Smart YouQ leverages AI Models built with IBM Watson® Studio and research from NASA to help you improve alertness and promote the building of better habits. *Battery life varies based on usage.

reviews.reviewerName: Dan and Alycia SingletonDan and Alycia Singleton
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s not an Apple Watch!
reviews.reviewText: It’s not an Apple Watch!And it’s not claiming to be an Apple Watch!This is a fitness tracker, watch for people that hate smart watches. I’ve had 2 Apple watches 2 different fitbits, and I own several analog brand-name watches (seiko, citizen, tag).I wanted to watch that would track my basic fitness stuff ( fitness, notifications, time, ) but not look terrible like pretty much all smart watches do. also I wanted a watch that I did not have to think about too much or bother charging every day like a smart watch.The citizens CZ , was pretty much exactly what I was looking for.A watch I could wear every day.A watch that tracks my Fitness stuffA watch I did not have to charge every dayPros:First. the watch looks great. I get people asking what kind of watches all the time.Second. It does a good job of keeping track of my steps, heart rate, 02, all the normal stuff that a fitness watch should do.Third. The battery has an insanely long life.(legitimately, I waited to write this review until I went through almost a full battery life cycle. It has been roughly 2 weeks and I’m still at 14% battery life.!!!!)Fourth. I love the fact that you can change the watch face at Will or even add your own pictures or designs to make it 100% custom if you should wish.Cons.First. The YouQ app 🤦‍♂️ I would love to say whether it is bad or good, but I have yet to be able to get it to actually connect to the watch.(I don’t think that is the watches fault as much as the apps fault. The app simply cannot find the watch over Bluetooth.) hopefully they will fix that some day.But… the Citizen Connected app does keep track of all of my fitness stats so I’m not super concerned with theYouQ app … right now.Second. The one thing I have noticed with the watch is that it doesn’t necessarily update your fitness scores on the watch face in real time..ie. heart rate, there seems to be a slight lag, of a couple of minutes. (hopefully that will be fixed with an update.)All in all, I like the watch. And will continue to wear it on a daily basis as my “daily beater watch”.If you’re looking for a smart watch that is “like an Apple Watch” then just go buy an Apple Watch. If you’re looking for a smart watch that looks good ,does all the basic things you need and has a great battery life then this might be the ones you’re looking for. IMO

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pretty interesting hybrid
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't have the fancy touch screen and the UI are pretty limited, but I never was interested in playing the tiny watch screen anyway.It looks and works like a real dress watch, with some basic smart watch features, and a very long battery life (2 weeks), that is what I really want for a watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Hybrid Smartwatch!
reviews.reviewText: I own MANY watches as well as quite a few smartwatches. I go all of the way back to Pebble and Motorola and as recent as Mobvoi and Amazfit. I own 2 Skagen hybrid smartwatches. I am very familiar with smartwatches.I love this great looking watch! It is a hybrid and does NOT behave like a traditional smartwatch. If you buy this watch you need to understand and embrace this simple fact! Once you take the time to understand the watch, what it DOES do and how it works you may love it as much as I do.Customer service is amazing! I had a question right away and used the app to send it. A few hours later I had an answer. The next morning I called their number and opted for them to call me back. I spoke to a VERY knowledgeable representative who answered any and all questions that I had.If you like wearing a great looking traditional watch with some features of a smartwatch buy this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 3 days battery Life. Difficult to see Data watch. Can not see in dark. Block out Bluetooth.
reviews.reviewText: Good:1. Solid structure2. Accuracy in timekeepingBad:1. 3-5 days battery life2. Difficult to read number3. Can not see anything at night4. The clap on the band did not lock and popped open.5. Took over Bluetooth and blocked out other devices6. No customer services from Citizen watchesReturn the watch to Amazon. The cost is almost the cost of the iPhone 9, and I will upgrade to the iPhone 9.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I wanted to love this watch so bad...
reviews.reviewText: I am giving this watch two stars because I really like the external design. But that is where my love ends. This watch has (in theory) what I wanted: a hybrid design so I can see the time all the time without having to activate the screen (and use battery power) and a minimalistic, B&W background with just the extra info that I need. Admittedly, setting up the watch and connecting it to my phone was a breeze. The main problem is that of all the nice watch faces that are offered, only two actually show the info. All the others (including those that I've customized to show what I actually wanted to see) were just black where the info was supposed to be. Therefore, it is useless. Adding to that pain, the backlight is supposed to be activated by double-tapping the screen. Well, it doesn't. I had to tap several times until the light came off, and then it was only for a couple of seconds. Enough to see the time, but not to read a message. They could have added a small button on the left to turn it on and off and some glow-in-the-dark paint to the watch so you don't have to turn the backlight on if you only want to see the time. Maybe they get it right on generation 3?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars it works as promised
reviews.reviewText: Where do I start?!!!..the watch discription was accurate... its simple to program and operate.Its a very handsome watch....no, its not a dress watch...its not meant to be.the updates and syncing are a bit delayed...but acceptable.the watch face choices are very interesting...many to choose from....It is not a Galaxy 6 or so, but ...I feel its a better , more functional watch for many of us.I am happy I made the choice.Especially with its long battery life.now that I have worn it for several weeks...ihave to change my mind somewhat,the sleep tracker seems accurate but i have towear the watch on the back side of my wrist.I am a avid bicyclist...but it only records my partiial route.step counting does not correspond with my fitbit ..I still think its worth the money....

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE THIS WATCH
reviews.reviewText: Bought to track a bunch of stuff and it works. Looks great and it's a Citizen. Battery lasts for a long time between charges. Still trying to find all the things about this watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Nice watch serves the purpose intended for, became a fan of it
They hit this one out of the park. Great watch
